question_text: What does it mean for a decision problem to be decidable?
correct_answer: An effective method exists that always derives the correct yes-or-no answer.
distractors: An effective method exists that sometimes derives a correct yes-or-no answer.
An efficient polynomial-time algorithm exists that derives the correct answer.
A nondeterministic machine exists that halts on at least one computation path.

question_text: In the Chomsky hierarchy, which type of automaton recognizes context-free languages?
distractors: Deterministic finite automaton.
Linear-bounded nondeterministic Turing machine.
Nondeterministic Turing machine with unlimited tape.

question_text: What is a parse tree in formal language theory?
correct_answer: An ordered, rooted tree representing a string's syntactic structure according to a context-free grammar.
distractors: A directed acyclic graph representing semantic dependencies between tokens in a regular grammar.
An unordered tree representing the runtime execution trace of a deterministic pushdown automaton.
A binary tree mapping each input symbol to its corresponding output in a finite-state transducer.

question_text: What characterizes an algorithm that runs in polynomial time?
correct_answer: Its running time is bounded by O(n^k) for some constant k, where n is the input size.
distractors: Its running time is bounded by O(k^n) for some constant k, where n is the input size.
Its running time is bounded by O(n log n) regardless of the input size.
Its running time is bounded by O(n!) for some constant factorial of the input size.

question_text: In complexity theory, what does it mean to reduce problem A to problem B?
correct_answer: Transform instances of A into instances of B so that solving B efficiently also solves A.
distractors: Transform instances of B into instances of A so that solving A efficiently also solves B.
Prove that problems A and B have identical worst-case running times on all inputs.
Decompose problem A into smaller independent subproblems that are each equivalent to B.

question_text: What does the pumping lemma for regular languages state?
correct_answer: Every sufficiently long string in a regular language has a middle section that can be repeated any number of times.
distractors: Every sufficiently long string in a context-free language has a middle section that can be repeated any number of times.
Every string in a regular language can be split into two halves that are each independently regular.
Every sufficiently long string in a regular language has a prefix that can be deleted to produce a shorter valid string.

question_text: What does the Church-Turing thesis assert?
correct_answer: A function on natural numbers is effectively calculable if and only if it is computable by a Turing machine.
distractors: A function on natural numbers is effectively calculable if and only if it runs in polynomial time.
A function on natural numbers is computable by a Turing machine if and only if it is expressible in first-order logic.
A function on natural numbers is decidable if and only if it can be verified by a nondeterministic Turing machine.

question_text: What did Cantor's 1891 diagonal argument originally prove?
correct_answer: There exist infinite sets that cannot be put into one-to-one correspondence with the natural numbers.
distractors: There exist finite sets that cannot be enumerated by any algorithmic procedure.
There exist infinite sets that can always be put into one-to-one correspondence with the rationals.
There exist countably infinite sets whose power sets have the same cardinality.

question_text: According to Savitch's theorem, what is the relationship between PSPACE and NPSPACE?
correct_answer: They are equal: PSPACE equals NPSPACE.
distractors: NPSPACE strictly contains PSPACE.
PSPACE strictly contains NPSPACE.
They are incomparable and neither contains the other.

question_text: What does the Cook-Levin theorem establish?
correct_answer: The Boolean satisfiability problem is NP-complete.
distractors: The Boolean satisfiability problem is in P.
The graph isomorphism problem is NP-complete.
The halting problem is reducible to Boolean satisfiability in polynomial time.
